list_definition.definition: an unusual sensitiveness of the body which causes certain people to be affected in a bad way by something usually harmless

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The rash on her face is caused by an allergy to grass.

list_ex_of_english: The authors concluded that the atopic nature of the parents significantly affected the allergy incidence in their children.
By the same token, individuals with an extremely sensitive immune system may more easily fall prey to severe allergies or autoimmune diseases.
A psychiatric study of patients with supposed food allergy.
Leather dust can be carcinogenic and causes allergies, both of which represent a threat to the local population.
If a patient reported year-round allergies, they were classified as suffering from a chronic allergic condition.
Most of the proteins that have been engineered into crops have no chance of causing allergies.
However, the relationship between changes in rates of infection and allergy is complex and not fully understood.
Other maternal dietary factors such as fat and antioxidant intake may have changed over the years contributing to the raised prevalence of allergy.
